parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A fall; a carcass, corpse, dead body. From the alternate of pipto; a ruin, i.e., lifeless body.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To bury. A primary verb; to celebrate funeral rites, i.e. Inter.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To report (from one place to another), bring a report, announce, declare. From apo and the base of aggelos; to announce.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
